intro: Oenanthe huanaca, commonly known as the Huanaca waterdropwort, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in the Andean regions of Peru and Bolivia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest understories. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels. Oenanthe huanaca is characterized by its distinctive, elongated fruits that contain a single seed.
